title: Quiz 8: Religion, Politics & Health Institutions
description: Test your understanding of religious, political, and health care institutions and their functions in society.

questions.question: Which of the following is a foundation of religion involving the search for an organising principle to validate strivings and make sense of suffering?

options.text: Self-justification and quest for ultimate meaning

questions.explanation: Religion provides meaning and justification for human existence and suffering.

questions.question: Match the political leadership style to its description:

pairs.right: Leader controls all power and assumes all responsibility
Leader involves employees in decision making
Leader allows employees to make decisions (free-reign)

questions.explanation: Autocratic = Authoritarian. Democratic = Participative. Laissez-faire = Delegative.

questions.question: What are the main functions of government? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Government maintains order, coordinates services, and protects citizens. Salvation is religious.

questions.question: In Kenya, the ___BLANK___ National Hospital serves as the teaching, research, and national referral hospital.
questions.explanation: Kenyatta National Hospital (KNH) is the top referral facility.

questions.question: Which health facility is typically found at the location level and offers basic health services to the immediate neighbourhood?
questions.explanation: Health Centres serve locations. Dispensaries serve sub-locations.

questions.question: Traditional medicine is no longer used in Kenya because everyone goes to modern hospitals.
questions.explanation: Traditional medicine is still used, especially for emotional/social treatment, though less than before.

questions.question: What is the difference between an Association and an Institution?

options.text: An Association is a formal group (e.g., a hospital), while an Institution is a mechanism of social order (e.g., Health Care).
An Institution is a building, an Association is a belief.

questions.explanation: Associations are specific organized groups. Institutions are broader social structures/systems.

questions.question: Which function of religion helps members cope with anxiety and provides explanations for the unknown (e.g., death)?
questions.explanation: Religion reduces stress by explaining the unknown and providing comfort.

questions.question: Which leadership style is described as 'abusive and unprofessional' if it involves yelling and threats, but is valid when time is short and the leader has all information?
questions.explanation: Autocratic leadership is valid in crises but shouldn't be abusive.

questions.question: Local governments are responsible for promoting social and economic development at the community level.
questions.explanation: Local governments play a key role in local development and service provision.
